reviews.snippet:
Our first experience of halal wagyu in Japan and it didn't disappoint, food was very nice and well presented and the experience of Yakiniku was good.

Food tasted good, we booked in advance and staff were very nice.

Prices were quite high but I suppose that's the price of Wagyu.

reviews.snippet:
The wagyu was heavenly. Insanely delicious and tender. You owe it to yourself to try it if you ever visit Tokyo.

I also tried another branch in Osaka but the place itself was very tiny you could barely move. Food was good still.

Highly recommended!

Also if you plan to go after 6 or 7pm, it's better to book a table ahead through their website as the place can get super busy and you would have to wait if you don't have a reservation.

reviews.snippet:
we went to this restaurant without reservation , it was really calm and cozy. The personal was really kind and ofc the beef was really good . We ate well a set of beef and it is served with a soup , a salade , a bowl of rice and sauce .
I recommend you this restaurant if you eat halal food and if you want to try the wagyu meat !! its really a must do if you're in japan .

reviews.snippet:
If you’re seeking an exceptional halal wagyu experience in Tokyo, Halal Wagyu Yakiniku PANGA in Taito is a must-visit. Renowned for its premium A5-grade Japanese Black Wagyu, this restaurant offers a delightful yakiniku (Japanese BBQ) experience tailored for halal diners. ￼

⸻

🥩 Wagyu Quality & Halal Assurance

PANGA sources whole wagyu cattle from Iwate Prefecture, ensuring a variety of cuts and consistent quality. The meat is processed in strict accordance with Islamic law, under the supervision of the Japan Halal Foundation, guaranteeing a 100% halal dining experience . ￼ ￼

⸻

🍽️ Menu Highlights

The menu boasts a range of delectable options:
•	Wagyu Kalbi (Short Rib): ¥2,500
•	Wagyu Rosu (Lean Beef): ¥2,700
•	Wagyu Harami (Skirt Steak): ¥2,800
•	Wagyu Jo-Kalbi (Premium Short Rib): ¥3,500
•	Wagyu Jo-Rosu (Premium Lean): ¥3,800
•	Wagyu Tongue: ¥3,000
•	Wagyu Steak: ¥5,500
•	Assorted Wagyu Platter: ¥7,500
•	Yakiniku Set Meal: ¥3,200
•	Wagyu Beef Bowl: ¥2,200
•	Bibimbap: ¥1,500
•	Kimchi & Side Dishes: ¥900 ￼

These offerings provide a comprehensive taste of wagyu’s rich flavors and textures .

⸻

🏠 Ambiance & Facilities

The restaurant features a warm, natural interior with ceramic art-adorned walls, creating a cozy atmosphere. With 74 seats, including semi-private rooms, it’s suitable for various group sizes. Facilities include free Wi-Fi, English-speaking staff, and an English menu, ensuring a comfortable experience for international guests . ￼ ￼

⸻

📍 Location & Hours
•	Address: 3-27-9 Taito, Taito City, Tokyo 110-0016, Japan
•	Access: 3-minute walk from Shin-Okachimachi Station (Oedo Line, A2 exit); 10-minute walk from Okachimachi Station (JR Yamanote Line)
•	Hours:
•	Monday–Saturday: 11:30 AM–2:00 PM (Lunch), 5:00 PM–11:00 PM (Dinner)
•	Sunday: 5:00 PM–10:00 PM ￼ ￼
